search_term: Find the official pricing page URL for Storage by Zapier (storage.com). Only provide the exact URL to the pricing page, not a summary of pricing information.
response_text: The official pricing page for Zapier, including Storage by Zapier, can be found here: [https://zapier.com/pricing](https://zapier.com/pricing)【3:0†source】.

Scalable automation for businesses of all sizes
===============================================

[Zaps](https://zapier.com/pricing#zaps)[Tables](https://zapier.com/pricing#tables)[Interfaces](https://zapier.com/pricing#interfaces)[ChatbotsBeta](https://zapier.com/pricing#chatbots)

Workflow automation plans
-------------------------

Zapier plans give businesses—both big and small—all the automation tools needed to build and scale end-to-end workflows.

Pay monthlyPay yearly (Save 33%)

Pay yearly (Save 33%)

How many tasks per month do you need?

Best for basic use

Free
----

Automate basic workflows with 100 tasks per month.

$

0

USD per month

Free forever

[Try it free](https://zapier.com/sign-up?from=logged-out-pricing-page-free)

Free plan features:

Zapier automation platform

The Zapier automation platform gives you access to Zaps, Interfaces (Basic), and Tables (Basic). Connect user interfaces, data tables, and Zaps with logic to automate custom workflows—all on Zapier.

Unlimited Zaps

No matter what plan you choose, you can create as many Zaps as your task limit allows.

Two-step Zaps

Two-step Zaps have one trigger (e.g., a new email lead) and one action (e.g., add the lead to my CRM) so you can connect two apps and automatically move data from one to the other.

AI power-ups

Create Zaps with the AI-powered Zap builder. Use AI to customize your Zaps by generating code steps, mapping data fields across apps, writing documentation for Zaps, and troubleshooting Zaps when there's an error.

Best for individuals

Professional
------------

Automate advanced workflows with the full power of Zapier.

Starting from

$

19

.99

USD per month

Billed annually

[Try it free](https://zapier.com/sign-up?from=logged-out-pricing-page-pro)

Everything in Free, plus:

Multi-step Zaps

Create Zaps that perform as many actions as you want from a single trigger. Add powerful workflow features to your Zaps like conditional paths, data formatting, trigger scheduling, and more.

[Unlimited Premium apps](https://zapier.com/apps?filter=premium)

Premium apps are select apps exclusively available to users on paid plans.

Webhooks

Build powerful, custom integrations that connect any app with Webhooks by Zapier.

Email support

Connect with our technical support team through email.

Email and live chat support

Connect with our technical support team through email or real-time, live chat\* (\*live chat is available for Professional plan users on a 2,000+ task tier)

Best for teams

Team
----

Build and manage automated workflows with your team.

Starting from

$

69

USD per month

Billed annually

[Try it free](https://zapier.com/sign-up?from=logged-out-pricing-page-team&currency=USD&next=%2Fapp%2Fteam-account-setup)

[Contact Sales](https://zapier.com/l/contact-sales?demo_source=pricing-logged-out_teams)

Everything in Professional, plus:

25 users

A user can build and edit a Zap.

Shared workspaces

Share access to your Zaps with your team, create folders, and customize permissions.

Shared app connections

Connect your team’s favorite tools so everyone can use them in their workflows without needing to share passwords and API keys.

SAML SSO

Ensure secure access for your team using SAML 2.0 identity and access management (IAM) providers.

Premier Support

Get faster, prioritized responses from our dedicated Premier Support team.

Best for organizations

Enterprise
----------

Scale automation across multiple departments.

Contact for pricing

[Contact Sales](https://zapier.com/l/contact-sales?demo_source=pricing-logged-out_gated_enterprise)

Everything in Team, plus:

Unlimited users

A user can build and edit a Zap.

Advanced admin permissions and app controls

Ensure that only the right people have access to sensitive apps, Zaps and more. Get as granular as which actions can be used for what apps.

Annual task limits

Instead of tasks expiring monthly, they’ll expire annually, so you don’t need to worry about budgeting tasks.

Observability

Get a 360° view of your account. See what users are building and which apps they’re using with Analytics, export activity to a SIEM tool with our Zap Runs API, and more.

Technical Account Manager

Get a Technical Account Manager who’s intimately familiar with your account to help field questions from your team and make strategy recommendations.

[More about Enterprise](https://zapier.com/enterprise)

What you get with all paid plans
--------------------------------

### The full building power of Zapier

Visual no-code editor

Unlimited app integrations

All built-in data and AI workflow tools

### Advanced Zap management capabilities

Zap version control

Custom error notifications

Advanced Zap settings

### Basic access to the Zapier automation platform

Zapier Tables

Zapier Interfaces

Zapier Chatbots

See all features

Build end-to-end solutions with Zapier
--------------------------------------

All-in-one automation starter kit

Get started creating custom solutions with Zapier’s automation products, bundled together and discounted.

**Includes**: Zaps Professional, Tables Pro, Interfaces Pro

[Learn more](https://zapier.com/l/pro-automation-platform)

Store, edit, share, and automate your data—all in one place. Free to try.

Our commitment to flexible, risk-free pricing
---------------------------------------------

### Your plan, your way

Pick any task tier, and if you reach your limit, you can switch to pay-as-you-go until you’re ready for a higher tier.  

### More valuable as you grow

The higher the task tier, the lower the cost per task. No matter which plan you choose, you'll get more value the more you use Zapier.  

### Commit and save

Commit to annual payments for a lower monthly fee. Or talk with our Sales team for access to deeper discounts on our Enterprise plan.  

Trusted by companies large and small

Join 2.2 million businesses using Zapier to grow their business
---------------------------------------------------------------

Frequently asked questions
--------------------------

### Zapier overview

Do I need to know how to code?

Nope! Zapier makes it easy for you to move data between your apps without being a developer. We may need you to locate information for certain accounts, but we'll guide you through any additional steps. Our Support champions are also here to help you via email should you need assistance.

What are apps?

An app is a web service or application, such as [Google Docs](https://zapier.com/apps/google-docs/integrations), [Evernote](https://zapier.com/apps/evernote/integrations), or [Salesforce](https://zapier.com/apps/salesforce/integrations). Zapier offers integrations for more than 7,000 apps and helps you easily move data between them to automate repetitive tasks. [Premium apps](https://zapier.com/apps?filter=premium) are select apps exclusively available to users on paid Zapier plans.

What is a Zap?

A Zap is an automated workflow that connects your apps and services together. Each Zap consists of a trigger and one or more actions. When you turn your Zap on, it will run the action steps every time the trigger event occurs.

What are tasks?

A task is counted every time a Zap successfully moves data or completes an action for you automatically. For example, if your Zap has an action to create new Google Contacts, each contact created will use one task. If the action isn't successfully completed, it doesn't count against your task limit.

What is a trigger?

A trigger is an event that starts a Zap. Once you turn on a Zap, Zapier will monitor for that trigger event. For example, if you create a Zap that sends a message to a rep each time you get a new lead, the trigger is a new lead entering your lead management app. Triggers don't count toward your task limit.

What's the difference between Zaps, triggers, actions, and tasks?

Zap is our term for the automated workflows you set up to connect your apps. A trigger is the event that starts your Zap. Actions are events that happen automatically after your Zap is triggered. For example, in a Zap that sends a message to a Sales rep each time you get a new lead, the trigger is the new lead entering your lead management app, and the action is the Slack notification sent with the new lead's info.

When Zapier performs an action successfully, it counts as a task. Each successful action in a Zap counts as a separate task.

Does checking (or polling) for new data use tasks?

Zapier never charges you a task to check for new data—only when a Zap successfully completes an action for you.

For instance, say you want an automated workflow to check—or poll—your Dropbox account every five minutes for new files. Then, if a new file appears, the workflow will send you a Slack message. In this case, sending the Slack message about the new Dropbox file counts as a task.

How many tasks do I need?

The number of tasks you need depends on the number of active Zaps you have and how frequently those Zaps run to automate your work. The more actions your Zaps complete, the more tasks you'll need.

But don't worry! When you reach your plan’s task limit, we'll notify you via email. When you reach your plan’s task limit, we'll also switch you to [pay-per-task billing](https://help.zapier.com/hc/en-us/articles/15279018245901#h_01HKCH7TXPGX4SZBRP521QYY5Y).

What happens if I hit my task limit?

We'll email you when you reach your plan's task limit. Once you've reached that limit, we'll switch you to pay-per-task billing at a rate of 1.25x the cost of a base task on your subscription so your Zaps continue running.

When you're on pay-per-task billing, we’ll email you if you’re close to your plan’s maximum task limit (3x your task subscription) and then again when you reach it. Once you’ve reached your maximum task limit, your Zaps will pause until the start of your next pay period.

You can [learn more about task overages here](https://help.zapier.com/hc/en-us/articles/15279018245901-Metered-tasks-in-Zapier). Our [Sales team](https://zapier.com/l/contact-sales?demo_source=pricing-logged-out_faq_section) is also available to help you choose the right plan for your business.

Will I be charged a task for any of Zapier’s built-in data tools?

Zapier offers a variety of [built-in data tools in the App Directory](https://zapier.com/apps/categories/zapier-tools) that help you add conditional filter and path logic, and format data. The following steps don't count as a task:

*   Zapier Tables
*   Zapier Interfaces
*   Filter by Zapier
*   Formatter by Zapier
*   Path by Zapier
*   Delay, Looping, Sub-Zap, Digest, Zapier Manager, Storage

How many connections does Zapier support?

Zapier connects to 7,000+ apps, more than any other automation tool. If you want to connect your internal tools, you can build your own private integration with our easy-to-use [developer platform](https://developer.zapier.com/).

### Plans and payments

Should I use the Team or Enterprise plan?

The Team plan provides features that facilitate collaboration on automation across several groups or teams. These features include shared app connections and a shared workspace.

The Enterprise plan enables your entire team to use Zapier, with advanced security features, governance, and monitoring features such as advanced admin permissions and custom data retention. Enterprise allows you to empower all of your employees while providing safeguards you need to protect sensitive data and critical workflows.

Which plans allow for unlimited users?

Unlimited users are available only on the Enterprise plan.

Do you have a free trial of your premium features?

Yes! When you create a new Zapier account, you're instantly enrolled in a [free 14-day trial](https://zapier.com/help/account/billing-pricing/understand-your-free-zapier-trial) of the Zapier Professional plan. No credit card required.

Please [contact our Sales team](https://zapier.com/l/contact-sales?demo_source=pricing-logged-out_faq_section) if you want to enroll in a free trial of the Zapier Team and Enterprise plans to experience our most advanced collaboration features and admin controls.

Can I change my plan later?

Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade at any time. If you upgrade, the change happens immediately, and you'll only pay a prorated amount for the rest of the billing cycle. If you choose to downgrade, it'll take effect at the end of that billing cycle.

What if I decide to cancel?

If you no longer wish to use Zapier, you may cancel at any time. You'll still have access to your paid plan for the remainder of your billing cycle. See also our [refund policy](https://help.zapier.com/hc/en-us/articles/8496260621197-Zapier-s-refund-policy) here.

Do you offer any discounts?

Yes! When you choose to pre-pay for a year of service, you'll receive a discount compared to monthly payments. Please see the pricing details above.

We also offer an additional 15% discount for non-profits. Learn more [here](https://zapier.com/non-profits/).

Can you charge me in my local currency?

Yes, we currently accept payment in multiple currencies with more currencies being added soon. You can see a list all of our accepted payment methods and currencies [here](https://zapier.com/help/account/billing-pricing/charging-in-local-currency).

Can I pay via invoice or wire transfer?

You can pay via invoice or wire transfer if you are on an Enterprise plan. To learn more, visit [Zapier for Enterprise](https://zapier.com/enterprise).

### Sales and support

Do you have a Sales team?

Yes, you can [contact our Sales team](https://zapier.com/l/contact-sales?demo_source=pricing-logged-out_faq_section) to book a demo for our Professional, Team, and Enterprise plans.

What level of support do Team and Enterprise plans get?

Team and Enterprise plans get Premier Support, which provides faster, prioritized responses from our dedicated Premier Support team.

On top of Premier Support, the Enterprise plan gives you a customized onboarding program, a Technical Account Manager, and a Customer Success Manager to help answer questions and work with your team in building advanced workflows.

What if I have more questions?

Try searching for what you need in our [Help and Support](https://zapier.com/support/) site. If you don't find what you're looking for, you can [get help](https://zapier.com/app/get-help?topic=account&from_url=https%3A%2F%2Fzapier.com%2Fpricing) here.

[Contact us](https://meetings.hubspot.com/joshua-barnes/ai-chatbot-advanced-plan) if you need additional chatbots or don’t see a plan that works for you.

Cookies settings
----------------

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.  
[More about cookies](https://cookiepedia.co.uk/giving-consent-to-cookies)

### Customize which cookies to allow

#### Marketing cookies

 Marketing cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

*   ##### Social media cookies
    
     Switch Label label
    
    These cookies are set by a range of social media services that we have added to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks. They are capable of tracking your browser across other sites and building up a profile of your interests. This may impact the content and messages you see on other websites you visit. If you do not allow these cookies you may not be able to use or see these sharing tools.
    

Cookies details‎

#### Analytics/performance cookies

 Analytics/performance cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalization, and allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. These cookies may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly and we will not know how you are using our site.

*   ##### Functional cookies
    
     Switch Label label
    
    These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.
    

Cookies details‎

#### Essential cookies

Always active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

Cookies details‎
